page.title: 01SEASCALE & GOSFORTH
page.content: Our villages lie between the mountains and the sea. For thousands of years this area remained remote & unchanged. The names show them to have been settled since Viking times, but the first change came with the arrival of the{railway}in 1847.Then in 1950 the atomic Power station at Sellafield began to{employ }more people.So from being an entirely { {farming }area it has become an industrial area, although the {Power {Station }is tucked out of sight.The { {houses }in both villages reflect this change, being a mixture of Victorian and present-day styles, the latter being grouped in estates.Both villages are self-sufficient in{shops}&{ {entertainment,}although {transport}by car is universal,so people are used to going elsewhere to find what they want.
